result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Christopher E Bornhofer was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IID restriction effective upon licensure for 36 mo

miscConds.notes: Court costs remitted. $942  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections. Def may reduce amount of fine by amount of assessment fee if receipt is provided to COC.
To be on sobrietor for first 6 mo.   Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

timeConds.notes: With huber and diversion. Provisions of 973.09(1)(d) (Good Time) apply. Court approves transfer to Columbia Co.  Credit does NOT apply.

records.addlTxt: Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 7/18/22 sent electronically to DOC

01:30 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Robert Brendan Hurley.  ADA Lexi Keyes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count #2. 

Victim rights compliance.

COUNT #1    
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years 

CONDITIONS:
-Serve 90 days in DCJ, w/Huber, diversion, and good time, to commence f/w. Court approves transfer to Columbia County.
-Provide DNA sample
-To be on sobrietor for first six months
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1
$600 Fine 
-All CC waived. Fine, DNA surcharge, and V/W surcharge due on probation.
-Defendant may reduce amount of fine by amount of assessment fee if receipt is provided to COC 

-Revocation of drivers license for 36 months 
-Ignition Interlock Device required upon licensure for 36 months
-AODA assessment 

CREDIT:
-Days credit for time served: 3 days credit
-Days credit if revoked: 3 days credit

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Abby H./minutes given to bailiff
